result.execSummary:
The defendant Melisa A White Perren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both that equals full-time
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with known users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

The defendant is not to be at any location where illicit drugs or controlled substances are stored, sold, used, trafficked or found, including vehicles

No Contact with J.P., K.W., T.N., or B.E.

Court will leave the No Contact with Joshua P. up to the PO
.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations as deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Court costs/fees are assessed on the Felony charge only - Waived on the Misd. charge

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.addlTxt: Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed. GLD note and file.

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
GLD: set for hearing

2:52pm Def in court w/out Attorney.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court: Ms Perren, first I will note that you are 7 minutes late to Court.  I could have already issued a Warrant and left the bench.
I have several Sentence Violations, it is clear they are trying to work with you but you continue to violate.  What is the problem?
Def - The first few times it died was while I was sleeping...the last time I just didn't pay attention.
Court: You know you need a couple of hours while you are not sleeping to charge it correct?
Def - Yes
Court: I sentenced you to Jail time, the last 30 days on Monitoring.  You got support from JSS to get out early.
I need you to realize, the alternative is to be wearing a yellow jump suit again.  Do you understand that?
Def - Yes
Court: This is an alternative to jail, you are not free yet.  This is a big advantage to being in the jail.
I need this to stop or I will have to issue an Order to Detain.
Eklund - Attorney Kellis did request that the defendant sit for the rest of her time in the jail without release.
Court: He is not wrong, but I am going to give her one more chance today.
Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed. GLD set for hearing.
